data.description: Focus on extending the standard regression model. Topics include nonlinear regression models, maximum likelihood estimation, panel data, simultaneous equations, linear and nonlinear systems, analysis of discrete choice, limited dependent variables, empirical economic applications and policy analysis.
data.title: APPLIED ECONOMETRIC ANALYSIS II

data.description: Introduction to the standard linear regression model with an emphasis on application issues. Includes statistical foundation, hypothesis testing, functional form, model selection and procedures for handling violations of model assumption.
data.title: APPLIED ECONOMETRIC ANALYSIS I

data.description: Preparation for empirical work by examining contemporary econometric techniques as they are used in development, environment and natural resources, and agricultural economics. Review a selection of applied models using past and current research as examples. Develop a deeper understanding of the many facets of empirical research in economics.
data.title: APPLIED ECONOMETRIC ANALYSIS III
